channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: The bollard was ripped out by a lorry. Repair to pavement badly done, now a trip hazzard. No bollard replaced, 23rd May
item.description:
Corner of High St and Castle St by White Hart pub. Very uneven/loose surface now a trip hazzard. Need to be sorted v. soon.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): High Street, Winchcombe, Winchcombe
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Other damage to pavement i.e. cobbles, raised mound/surface

item.title: Pedestrian button deactivates whilst waiting at lights., 23rd May
item.description:
The location is on Hewlett Road, close to the Badhams Chemist. Shortly after a pedestrian calls for the light to change so that (s)he can cross the road safely, the green light on the button returns to red without activating the crossing (i.e. the request self-cancels). This appears to be an intermittent fault.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 89, Hewlett Road, Fairview, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Green or amber traffic light is not working

item.title: Two people this week have tripped and injured themselves seriously along this strip of pavement these past 2 days alone, with an area of uneven pavement slabs along the attached image location., 23rd May
item.description:
Outside 2-10 Great Norwood Street pavement area. Specifically outside number 4.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 6A, Great Norwood Street, Montpellier, Cheltenham

item.title: Both 30mph speed limit signs are obscured by vegetation, 23rd May
item.description:
When entering Cheltenham on the Cirencester Road, there are speed limit signs (on both sides of the road) either side of LillyBrook Golf Course of 40mph and 30mph. The 30mph signs on both sides of the road are obscured by vegetation. One is due to an over hanging tree and the other, on the other side of the road is completely covered by vegetation. During the recent resurfacing of this road, a lot of traffic calming paintwork has been applied to the road but this is undermined because drivers entering Cheltenham won't see the 30mph speed limit signs.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Hartley Close, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Grass over ran the pavement, 22nd May
item.description:
The public pavement from twigworth green to norton school has been became over grown woth hedges and the grass verge has moved onto the pavement making it very difficult to fit a pramnor wheel chair on the pavement.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): A38, Twigworth, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Safety risk of fencing, 22nd May
item.description:
Fencing that I believe was used to contain bark for honeybourne line works, and doesn't seem to be serving a purpose anymore, was strewn across the path acting as trip or entanglement hazard. Can someone please remove or reinstate the fencing if still has a purpose to remove risk to people, dogs and wildlife.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Honeybourne, Hatherley, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Cycle lanes blocked by vehicles pulling out, 22nd May
item.description:
The new design of the adjoining roads junction means that cars now will stop in cycle lane to assess whether it’s safe to pull out. this has resulted in multiple near misses where cars pulled out not checking for cyclists in the cycle lane.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Hill Court Road, Marle Hill, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Ramp on mini roundabout, 22nd May
item.description:
When going north from the mini roundabout there is a sharp ramp from one road surface to another. This should be smoothed out to prevent vehicle damage
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 38, Evesham Road, Marle Hill, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet
